questionTitle: ______ sizing is possible when the system load is cyclical or in some cases when there are predictable bursts or spikes in the load.
questionExplanation: You encounter cyclical loads in many public facing commercial ventures with seasonal demands, when the load is affected by time zones.

questionOption1: A standard machine instance (virtual computer) might cost $0.10 or less an hour
questionOption2: A typical storage charge might be $0.10 per GB/month
questionOption3: Outsourcing shifts the burden of capital expenditures onto the service provider
questionExplanation: In reality, the major cloud providers provide machine instances in small slices that can be added within five minutes or less.

questionTitle: _____ is a financial estimate for the costs of the use of a product or service over its lifetime.
questionExplanation: TCO stands for Total Cost of Ownership.

questionTitle: The Microsoft ____ Platform ROI wizard provides a quick and dirty analysis of your TCO for a cloud deployment on Windows Azure in an attractive report format.
questionExplanation: A better metric for enterprises is captured by a Return on Investment or ROI calculation.

questionOption1: TCO must account for the real costs of items, but frequently they do not
questionOption2: A system consumes resources such as space in a datacenter or portion of your site, power, cooling, and management
questionOption3: Microsoft maintains an economics page for its Windows Azure Platform
questionExplanation: When you account for monitoring and management of systems, you must account for the burdened cost of an IT employee, the cost of the hardware and software that is used for management, and other hidden costs.

questionTitle: A ________ Level Agreement (SLA) is the contract for performance negotiated between you and a service provider.
questionExplanation: In the early days of cloud computing, all SLAs were negotiated between a client and the provider.

questionTitle: Which of the following is specified parameter of SLA?
questionExplanation: Some SLAs are enforceable as contracts.

questionTitle: When you purchase shrink-wrapped software, you are using that software based on a licensing agreement called ________
questionExplanation: EULA stands for End User License Agreement.

questionTitle: Cloud computing shifts capital expenditures into ________ expenditures.
questionExplanation: Cloud computing changes the nature of the service provider and its relationship to its client.

questionTitle: Which of the following service is used for backing up a licensed computer?
questionExplanation: Cloud computing applications rarely use machine licenses when the application is meant to be ubiquitous.
